title: Tuples & Dictionaries
concept: This level teaches storing and accessing keyâ€“value data using dictionaries and using tuples as immutable collections. You will practice counting, mapping, searching, sorting and frequency-based tasks.

challenges.title: Tuple Sum
challenges.description: Read N integers and store them in a tuple. Print their sum.
challenges.inputDescription: N then N integers separated by space.
challenges.starterCode:
n = int(input())
t = tuple(map(int, input().split()))
# print sum of tuple

challenges.title: Tuple Max & Min
challenges.description: Print maximum and minimum elements from tuple separated by space.
challenges.starterCode:
n = int(input())
t = tuple(map(int, input().split()))
# print max and min

challenges.title: Dictionary Lookup
challenges.description: Given N key:value pairs and a key K, print its value or Not Found.
challenges.inputDescription: N lines each key value, then a key K.
examples:
Input:
3
apple 10
orange 20
banana 15
orange
Output:
20

challenges.title: Character Frequency (Dictionary)
challenges.description: Read a string and count frequency of each character using a dictionary. Print only keys that appear in ascending order of character.
examples:
Input:
banana
Output:
a:3
b:1
n:2

challenges.title: Word Frequency
challenges.description: Count frequency of each word in a sentence and print in alphabetical order of words.
challenges.outputDescription: word:count on new lines sorted by word.
examples:
Input:
this is a test this is
Output:
a:1
is:2
test:1
this:2
challenges.starterCode:
s = input()
words = s.split()
freq = {}
# fill and print word counts sorted alphabetically

tests.input: this is a test this is

challenges.title: Dictionary Swap Key Value
challenges.description: Given N key:value pairs, swap them to value:key pairs and print entries sorted by key.

challenges.title: Second Most Frequent Character
challenges.description: Print the second most frequent character in string. If tie choose lexicographically smaller. If not possible print -1.
challenges.starterCode:
s = input()
# build freq dict and determine second most frequent

challenges.title: Phonebook
challenges.description: Given N entries (name number), then Q queries (names). For each query print number or Not Found.
challenges.inputDescription: N entries followed by Q names.
challenges.outputDescription: Number or Not Found each on new line.
examples:
Input:
3
Ram 999
Kiran 888
Shyam 777
2
Kiran
Amit
Output:
888
Not Found

challenges.title: Marks Dictionary
challenges.description: Given student names and marks, print name with highest marks.
challenges.inputDescription: N then N lines name marks.
examples:
Input:
3
Ram 50
Kiran 80
Akhil 70
Output:
Kiran

challenges.title: Tuple Pair Sorting
challenges.description: Given N pair tuples (a, b), sort them by a, and if tie by b. Print sorted pairs in format (a,b) separated by space.
challenges.inputDescription: N then N pairs a b.
challenges.starterCode:
n = int(input())
arr = []
# store tuples and sort then print same format
